utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Booya!

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: God!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guess who’s about to have the best day ever?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Could it be the fellow who just interrupted us rather rudely with “booya”?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s going on, Dad?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sorry, I can’t tell you. I’m sworn to secrecy.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Okay. Anyway, so my psych professor said fear is an emotion, which it is, but then I argued –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re not even going to try to pry the secret out of me?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Darling, we are right in the middle of something here, so if you just wait for a moment we will give you our full attention, okay? Okay. What is it, darling?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Gram, you know he’s just going to keep pouting until he gets his way. Dad, just tell us your secret.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. But only because you insisted.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just got off the phone with the personal assistant of none other than … Stephen King.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Whoa.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He is in town visiting his New York apartment, has called to see if I’m available for a meeting to talk about a, dramatic pause … … collaboration.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hold on, isn’t he still mad about … the thing?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: What thing?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: The baseball thing. See, Stephen King is a huge Red Sox fan and Dad –

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, and your father is Yankees fan. Oh no, Richard, what did you do?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It was a silly joke.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: More like a thinly veiled threat.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To-mato, to-mahto. Obviously it’s water under the bridge because he wants to talk about collaborating on a project.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: That’s great.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Richard Castle and Stephen King present... Wish me luck, ladies.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Darling, if you think you’re going to get top billing over Stephen King you’re going to need more than luck.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Good morning.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Morning.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Morning, Captain.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Lanie, how’re you doing?

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: A heck of a lot better than our victim here. Name is Emma Matthews, 34 years old, single GSW to the upper back, through and through. Here’s the exit wound. Based on lividity I’m placing the time of death between 9 and 11 last night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And the neighbors didn’t hear a gunshot?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, the music was turned up too loud. But neighbor next door said he saw a rusty white van parked outside near the time of death window. Didn’t get a plate, though.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Does Emma have a roommate?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nope, she lives alone. But we’ve notified next of kin and we’ve got a list of her friends and coworkers.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Emma was a television producer at Channel 8 news. Some of her coworkers are going to meet us back at the precinct.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s with the artwork?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not sure yet, but we think that our killer may have drawn it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, check with the FBI. See if the MO or the symbol matches anything in their database.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, how’s the meeting going? Uh, is Stephen still mad at you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just got here. And if he’s not still mad at me, he will be when I tell him to fire his real estate agent.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey! Be nice.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What, to Stephen or to the … team of rats that came to welcome me at the door? All right, I gotta go. I love you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Stephen? Is that you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. I get it. Very funny. Yeah. Yankees are still the best team –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Ryan, anything from the FBI?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No. The symbol’s not in their database. Neither is our killer’s MO.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what about the white, rusty van outside Emma’s apartment? You guys track it down?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No traffic cams on her block, so so far it’s not looking good.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey guys, these are Emma’s coworkers. This is Lila Campo and Jennifer Perez. This is my partner Detective Ryan and our boss, Captain Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry about your loss.

utterance.speaker: LILA CAMPO
utterance.content: Thank you, Captain. We are still in shock.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’re going to talk over here. Follow me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ryan, I’m going to be at the forensic technology seminar all afternoon, so just text me if anything comes up, okay?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You got it, Captain.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: JENNIFER PEREZ
utterance.content: Oh my God, is that Emma’s blood?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m afraid so. Do you recognize the symbol drawn on the mirror?

utterance.speaker: JENNIFER
utterance.content: I’ve never seen it before.

utterance.speaker: LILA
utterance.content: Neither have I.

utterance.speaker: JENNIFER
utterance.content: I mean, I just can’t believe this. Emma was the sweetest person in the world. I mean, she was kind, she was outgoing. Though she had been acting a little strange lately.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Strange how?

utterance.speaker: JENNIFER
utterance.content: Well, Emma had just gotten a promotion to produce the 8 o’clock news –

utterance.speaker: LILA
utterance.content: Which was a huge deal for her.

utterance.speaker: JENNIFER
utterance.content: Exactly. Yet, all this week she was acting kind of, I don’t know –

utterance.speaker: LILA
utterance.content: Off.

utterance.speaker: JENNIFER
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, any idea why?

utterance.speaker: JENNIFER
utterance.content: Well, Emma confided in me that she had gotten her hands on some kind of proof.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, proof of what?

utterance.speaker: JENNIFER
utterance.content: She said that she couldn’t tell me, at least not until after the time was right, whatever that meant.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Do either of you know if Emma was having personal problems with anyone? Anyone at work, in her personal life?

utterance.speaker: JENNIFER
utterance.content: Not that I know of.

utterance.speaker: LILA
utterance.content: Well, there’s Buckley.

utterance.speaker: JENNIFER
utterance.content: Yeah, but everyone in the newsroom has problems with Buckley.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Who’s Buckley?

utterance.speaker: JENNIFER
utterance.content: Another producer at the station. He has seniority over Emma but she beat him out for that promotion.

utterance.speaker: LILA
utterance.content: And Buckley was pissed.

utterance.speaker: JENNIFER
utterance.content: Yeah. I mean, he even claimed she had made up lies about him just to get the job.

utterance.speaker: LILA
utterance.content: But I can’t imagine he would kill her for that.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: By any chance does Buckley drive a white van?

utterance.speaker: LILA
utterance.content: Yeah. He does.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What am I, in kindergarten again? So where’s Mrs. Finch?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You are not Mrs. Finch.

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: Who are you guys?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where am I?

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: I don’t know. Me and this guy just woke up.

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: My shoulder’s killing me.

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: Anyone have a phone? Mine’s gone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: What the hell is going on? How did we get here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Last thing I remember I – I went to a rundown building, going to meet Stephen King, and all the lights went out.

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: Hold on. 143 Nicholas Street?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How did you know that?

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: A lawyer called, asked me to meet him there. Said I inherited the building from my uncle who passed away a year ago.

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: Yeah, I was told the same thing, except it was supposedly my cousin who died a few months ago.

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: Oh my God, we were all lured there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but by whom?

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: There’s a sticky substance on my arms. Do you guys have that?

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: This thing’s not budging.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, um … you know, when I was in that hallway and the lights went out, the last thing I remember was a sharp pain in my shoulder, so we must have been drugged with a syringe or a tranq dart.

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: But why? Who would do that to us?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My guess is whoever’s behind that camera.

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: Oh man, it’s a serial killer. I’ve seen stuff like this on Dateline and it never ends well.

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: Will you please shut the hell up?

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: I’m trying to tell you, this is –

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: Shut up!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys. Whoever is behind this, if they wanted us dead we would be dead. So obviously they want something else, right?

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: Yeah, but what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I – don’t know. Let’s take a look around. Obviously someone went to a lot of trouble designing this place.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. Guys. “Salvation lies within.”

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: What is that thing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s a cryptex. It’s kind of a lockbox that requires a password to open it, so we just need the password.

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: We need to bust out of here. Now.

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: The blade’s rubber.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa. Is that a bee?

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: Oh. I’m allergic. I’m very allergic.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, well, relax. You’re antagonizing it.

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: I think it’s attracted to the substance on my arm.

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: Oh no.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You all right? Okay, relax, relax. You’re going into anaphylactic shock. Do you have epinephrine?

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: My injector’s gone! It was in my pocket. Where is it? Where is it?

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: It’s okay, man. It’s okay. We’ll find it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys, there’s a picture of a bee. Maybe your epinephrine’s in here.

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: What should we do?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Um … we need the password.

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: Just breathe. Just breathe, all right? We’ll figure this out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys, some of the letters have bees over them. A, D, E, I, L, O, T, R, and Y.

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: Take it easy. What does that mean?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know. It could be a word. Maybe it’s a phrase. Uh, dairy pole. No. Uh … I play doer. A dire ploy.

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: Guys, he’s not looking so good.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait a minute. Play … or … die.

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: Oh man, this is so twisted.

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: Oh, thank you.

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: Hurry, hurry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. Ready?

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: Whoa. What did you do to him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nothing. I just put –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It says it’s poison. That’s not – salvation lies within. Salvation – lies. It was a trick.

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: Okay, okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Open his collar so he can breathe.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What is that?

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: So what the hell are we supposed to do now?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: You were right. Whoever’s behind this isn’t going to kill us. He wants us to kill each other.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I – – there’s another clue right here. “Time has run out. 2 – will cure. 1 – will kill.” Okay, so that has to mean there’s an antidote around here somewhere. Look around, guys. Look around. Look around.

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: What are we looking for?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Something around here. 2 – will cure. What does that mean?

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: Is it another injector? Is it a needle?

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: Hey guys, found something. Two will cure. Hang in there, buddy. This is number two. We’ve just got to give him number two.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait – wait, wait, something not right. Um … that’s too easy. Two, um …

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: But that’s what the clue said.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: 2 – will cure. What if that means a combination of two vials makes the antidote?

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well clearly we can’t take any of these clues for granted. Time has run out. What does that mean? Okay, the clock. That clock has stopped. Which is time has run out. And the hands are at 1 and 3, so … what if the antidote is the 1 and 3 vials combined?

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: Whoa.

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: You sure about this?

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: Oh, thank God.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You all right? Just breathe. Breathe.

utterance.speaker: BUCKLEY
utterance.content: Okay, why the hell am I here?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, Mr. Buckley, we understand that you had some issues with Emma Matthews.

utterance.speaker: BUCKLEY
utterance.content: I don’t know what you’re talking about. I liked Emma. It’s a real shame what happened to her.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, we’re sure you’re heartbroken. Especially after she supposedly lied to beat you out of that big promotion at work.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And now that Emma’s dead that new job is yours for the taking.

utterance.speaker: BUCKLEY
utterance.content: Whoa. Hold on. I may not be shedding tears over Emma’s demise but I didn’t kill her.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You own a white Ram 350 van, don’t you, Mr. Buckley.

utterance.speaker: BUCKLEY
utterance.content: Yeah. So?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So a van matching that description was seen outside Emma’s place during the time she was murdered.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Where were you between 9 and 11 last night?

utterance.speaker: BUCKLEY
utterance.content: At O’Malley’s Pub in Brooklyn. And my van was parked right out front. Ask anyone there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We will. And it better check out.

utterance.speaker: BUCKLEY
utterance.content: And just so you guys know, Emma did lie about me to get that promotion. That chick lied all the time.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: BUCKLEY
utterance.content: Just yesterday I caught her in the edit bay digitizing old VHS tapes. Emma said it was proof for a story. But I know all the stories she was working on and those videos had nothing to do with any of them.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Wait, didn’t Emma’s coworkers say she just stumbled on some sort of proof?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Buckley, what was on those tapes?

utterance.speaker: BUCKLEY
utterance.content: They were weird home videos of a couple of kids sitting around wearing these strange medallions.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Strange how?

utterance.speaker: BUCKLEY
utterance.content: I don’t know. They had round symbols.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did they look anything like this?

utterance.speaker: BUCKLEY
utterance.content: Yeah. Exactly like that.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Are there copies of these VHS tapes she was digitizing?

utterance.speaker: BUCKLEY
utterance.content: Yeah. The system automatically archives the raw footage to the server for backup.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How are you feeling?

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: Better. Thanks for saving me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: Hey, I don’t even know your name.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s right, we haven’t done proper introductions. I’m Rick.

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: Todd.

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: Yeah, my name’s Simon.

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: Judah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, gentlemen, um … clearly we were all brought here for a reason. Maybe if we can figure out what it is it’ll be our way out.

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: Okay, how do we do that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, we must have some sort of connection to each other.

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: Yeah, but I haven’t seen any of you guys in my life. Ever.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. But it may be some connection we’re not yet aware of. Um … I’m a mystery writer. What do you guys do for a living?

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: I’m a third grade teacher.

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: I’m a minister.

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: I own a boxing gym.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. All right, no connection there, but uh … where are you from? I’m born and raised in New York City.

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: Hey mystery writer, no one cares why we’re here. We only care about getting out.

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: I’m with him.

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: Me too. There’s gotta be something in here we can use to escape.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, Judah, the last time we broke something Todd nearly died.

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: Hey, pal. I’m not the one who injected him with poison, okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s exactly my point. Rummaging around may inadvertently spring another deadly trap.

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: We’ve got to do something.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Agreed. So let’s be smart about it. Um … the cryptex. It led us to the poison and the poison led us to the antidote.

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: Yeah, but there was no clue on the antidote.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The clock was part of that solution. Maybe it holds the next clue.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “The key will release you.” But what key?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY SHIPTON
utterance.content: Alexis? Where is your father?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: He’s not with you?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: If he were would I be asking you where he is?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Meow.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Okay, sorry, sorry. I don’t mean to get so b*tchy, it’s just that your father blew off that meeting I set up with a potential client.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: He had an impromptu get-together this morning with Stephen King. Maybe he’s still there.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Do you have King’s number?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No, but his assistant called my dad’s cell which is linked to the office computer. Okay, here’s his call log. Got it.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It’s disconnected. I must have misdialed. Something’s wrong.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: There’s a new tweet from Stephen King: “watch me live on Australia, 7PM, project, twenty minutes”.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: If Stephen King is in Australia where’s my dad?

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: The key will release you. But what key? Maybe it’s a metaphor.

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: Maybe you’re an idiot. Now will you please shut up so the grownups can think?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys, the bickering is not going to help us.

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: Maybe there’s something in this room that’s shaped like this keyhole.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know I’ve seen that shape before. Boys, we’re getting out of here.

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: Oh, come on.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “The last one standing will be freed.” Three bullets, four of us.

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: So what, whoever kills the others goes free?

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: Give me the gun, Rick.

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: No, no, no. I want the gun.

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Both of you stop. Stop it. You do and whoever’s behind this wins. Don’t you see?

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: Don’t you see? We’re powerless in here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, we’re not. We have the power not to play. You hear that? We’re not going to play your sick game anymore. You lose.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s another room. It’s identical to this one.

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: Meadow. What’s my wife doing in there?

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: That’s my girlfriend, Patty.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: MEADOW
utterance.content: It’s exactly the same.

utterance.speaker: PATTY
utterance.content: Everything’s the same.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle? Do you hear me? Castle? Castle?

utterance.speaker: MEADOW
utterance.content: That was my husband, Simon.

utterance.speaker: PATTY
utterance.content: And my boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which explains the texts that they used to lure us here. They must have been abducted first and then their phones were used to text us.

utterance.speaker: PATTY
utterance.content: But why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And more importantly, who’s that fourth man?

utterance.speaker: PATTY
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: MEADOW
utterance.content: Yeah. There were four guys on that screen but only three of us.

utterance.speaker: PATTY
utterance.content: What happened to the woman who was supposed to be in that chair?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What is that on your neck?

utterance.speaker: PATTY
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: MEADOW
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: PATTY
utterance.content: You have one, too.

utterance.speaker: MEADOW
utterance.content: What about me?

utterance.speaker: PATTY
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: MEADOW
utterance.content: Well, is that a good thing or bad thing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know, but the important thing here is to stay calm.

utterance.speaker: MEADOW
utterance.content: Screw calm. I say we break that glass and hack our way out of here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, that’s not a good idea.

utterance.speaker: MEADOW
utterance.content: Tough. If this isn’t an emergency I don’t know what is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, whoever is behind this isn’t stupid enough to leave something that we can use to go free, which means that’s a trap. Now, let’s just finish this puzzle and see what happens.

utterance.speaker: MEADOW
utterance.content: Fine. Knock yourself out.

utterance.speaker: PATTY
utterance.content: Something about this feels familiar.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: PATTY
utterance.content: Identical rooms, the tasks. In grad school I read a case study that examined separation anxiety in stressful situations.

utterance.speaker: MEADOW
utterance.content: Well, this certainly is stressful.

utterance.speaker: MEADOW
utterance.content: Oh, thank God.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: MEADOW
utterance.content: Having a smoke. I think I’ve earned it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No! I told you, you can’t trust anything in this place. This could kill you.

utterance.speaker: MEADOW
utterance.content: It’s a cigarette. It’s definitely going to kill me eventually.

utterance.speaker: MEADOW
utterance.content: What the hell is that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It smells like peanuts.

utterance.speaker: MEADOW
utterance.content: I’m allergic.

utterance.speaker: PATTY
utterance.content: Looks like Captain Beckett just saved your life. So how about you start being a team player?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I need you to tell me everything you can about this study.

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: What the hell is my wife doing in here? And yours?

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: They must be leverage. To make us follow the rules or else they get hurt.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or maybe we’re the leverage.

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: But what about Todd? He didn’t have anyone in that room.

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: He’s a priest. They’re celibate.

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: I’m a minister. The rules are different.

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: So is there a Mrs. Minister that’s not in there?

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: No. But that doesn’t mean that there aren’t people I care about. And if something happened to one of them I don’t –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look, we don’t know enough to be worried about that, okay?

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: Oh, hell, being locked in this room with a loaded gun and instructions to kill one another is plenty to be worried about.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’re not going to do that. What we should be doing is figuring out why the hell we’re here.

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: And why are some of us marked with a symbol and others aren’t?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you see the symbol on any of the women?

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: I saw something on Patricia’s neck, but I don’t have one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about your wife?

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re sure?

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: I didn’t take my eyes off of her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So she doesn’t have one but you do. Following that pattern, Beckett must have one because I don’t.

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: Meaning what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, what if the people with the symbol are the important ones and the rest of us are leverage?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: There he is.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What’s he doing in there? Wait, what’s going on with that van?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Uh, what the hell just happened?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Was that my dad?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So Buckley sent over the tapes that Emma was digitizing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, he’s right. It’s, uh … weird.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What are they doing?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Solving puzzles. For hours. And they’re wearing he symbol, just like Buckley said.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Could that little girl be Emma?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s possible. Based on clothing and picture quality the lab thinks that the tape is at least twenty years old.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: If it is Emma then who’s that little boy? And what do these videos have to do with her murder?

utterance.speaker: GIRL
utterance.content: I’m scared. I don’t want to play this game anymore. Please, let me out.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad’s missing and we can’t reach Beckett’s cell.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa. Hold on, hold on. Beckett’s at a forensics conference, Alexis.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No, she never showed.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Rick was lured to an empty building this morning. I hacked a nearby street camera and got footage of a white van fleeing the scene.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Neighbors saw a white van in front of Emma’s building.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Who’s Emma?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Our murder victim. We think our killer might have been driving a rusty, white van.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If the clue is right this must be the key.

utterance.speaker: MEADOW
utterance.content: I take back every bad thing I’ve been thinking about you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well, thank you.

utterance.speaker: PATTY
utterance.content: Just another mind game.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: “The last one standing will be freed.”

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Two bullets.

utterance.speaker: PATTY
utterance.content: And three of us. Clearly our captor’s trying to turn us against each other.

utterance.speaker: PATTY
utterance.content: What kind of sick new test is this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know, but it seems a little unsophisticated.

utterance.speaker: PATTY
utterance.content: Meadow! What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: MEADOW
utterance.content: It’s called survival of the fittest.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just more concrete, which falls into the “to be expected” column.

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: Oh no.

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: Sorry, boys. My wife’s got the right idea.

utterance.speaker: PATTY
utterance.content: Meadow, you don’t have to do this.

utterance.speaker: MEADOW
utterance.content: Look, it’s nothing personal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Give me the gun, Meadow. Shooting us isn’t going to get you out of here any faster.

utterance.speaker: MEADOW
utterance.content: Sorry, but it’s you or me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Simon, shooting us is not going to get that door open.

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: You don’t know that. The note says only one will survive. I need to make sure it’s me.

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: Don’t go down this path.

utterance.speaker: SIMON
utterance.content: Sorry, preacher.

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: He’s dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The barrel’s been sealed. This gun’s as rigged as this room.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This’ll have to do until I get you into real handcuffs.

utterance.speaker: MEADOW
utterance.content: Come on, can’t we work something out?

utterance.speaker: PATTY
utterance.content: You tried to kill us. If she hadn’t taken the bullets out you would have.

utterance.speaker: MEADOW
utterance.content: I wasn’t myself. It was fight or flight. Pure animal instinct.

utterance.speaker: MEADOW
utterance.content: No. Simon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m so sorry.

utterance.speaker: MEADOW
utterance.content: Save it. Your husband killed him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We don’t know that.

utterance.speaker: MEADOW
utterance.content: Get away from me.

utterance.speaker: PATTY
utterance.content: What are we going to do? This is all a game to our captor. We’re being manipulated.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re going to change the rules.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Just, give me a call whenever you hear something.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. I got something. Vikram scrubbed the footage. He found the name Northcliff written at the bottom of one of the puzzles. Now, when Emma was a teenager she walked dogs for a pair of psychiatrists, Jeffrey and Samantha Northcliff.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This is good.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. And it gets better. There was a break in at the Northcliffs' apartment the night before Emma was murdered. According to the police report, only personal property was taken.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The VHS tapes. She must have broken in to steal them.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But why?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Let’s ask the Northcliffs.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I can’t find them. But I got their secretary in the box right now.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: ROSE
utterance.content: So much tragedy. I hadn’t seem Emma since she was a teenager, and then I ran into her last week at Faye’s funeral.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Whose funeral?

utterance.speaker: ROSE
utterance.content: Faye Northcliff. Jeffrey and Samantha’s daughter.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What happened to her?

utterance.speaker: ROSE
utterance.content: She hung herself. The poor girl.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did she have any siblings?

utterance.speaker: ROSE
utterance.content: Yes, a twin brother, Brandon.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And are these the twins? Right here?

utterance.speaker: ROSE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Twenty five years ago the Northcliffs did groundbreaking research on separation anxiety in children.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But there were rumors of unethical behavior. And they were involved in some pretty fringe behavioral science.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Did the Northcliffs use their own children as test subjects?

utterance.speaker: ROSE
utterance.content: I wouldn’t know anything about that.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Emma’s dead, Rose. If she broke into the Northcliffs' apartment to steal those tapes then she was planning to expose them. It’s possible the Northcliffs killed her to keep that secret.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And if you don’t want to be charged as an accessory then you better come clean. Right now.

utterance.speaker: ROSE
utterance.content: You have to believe me. I didn’t know the experiments were doing harm to those children. Time has proven otherwise. Brandon fled the country, became a recluse. Poor Faye. You know what happened to her.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Do you have any idea where the Northcliffs might be right now?

utterance.speaker: ROSE
utterance.content: No. I haven’t seen them since yesterday. I swear to you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Guys. Hayley IDed the van.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: It’s registered to a professional corporation owned by somebody named Jeffrey Northcliff.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He and his wife are our prime suspects.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Did you get an address off the registration?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Yes, it’s a secluded property outside Hartsdale.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That could be where they’re holding Castle and Beckett. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is not going to happen. We need to work smarter.

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: How? That door’s the only way out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If we could find something we could use as a pry bar, we could get it between the lock and the frame, we might be able to pop it open.

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: Yeah, okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So the chemicals in there are explosive. It just needs a catalyst to set it off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Great. Fuse?

utterance.speaker: PATTY
utterance.content: Here you go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Perfect.

utterance.speaker: PATTY
utterance.content: I always loved the smell of this stuff.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. You two better hide.

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: What was that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know, but we need to get out of here. Now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just stay close. This could be another trap.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Get back!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s someone there. Stay close, okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa! Don’t shoot! It’s rigged to kill the shooter. That’s how Simon died.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jesus.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank God you’re okay.

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: Patricia.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, good.

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: We should keep moving.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It could be a trap.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, wait, wait!

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: It’s fine. We can get out!

utterance.speaker: PATTY
utterance.content: Let’s go. We can get out of here.

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: About damn time.

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: Oh, we’re free!

utterance.speaker: PATTY
utterance.content: We’re locked in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whatever they’re for, we’ve got less than five minutes to figure it out. That started counting down as soon as the doors closed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, clearly this room is our captor’s end game. He wanted us to end up here.

utterance.speaker: PATTY
utterance.content: Why? What does he want from us?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is that another clue?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Last piece of the puzzle: “Of those who remain only your better half can survive.”

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: What the hell does that mean?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There are six of us left and three levers. He wants to separate the couples. Make us choose who goes free.

utterance.speaker: PATTY
utterance.content: And who stays behind to pull the levers. I assume all three need to be pulled at once to open the door.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Unless that’s what he wants us to think. These levers could just as easily blow this room.

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: How’re we supposed to know?

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: We have to have faith.

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: Wait! Wait!

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: See? Faith. Now who’s staying in here with me?

utterance.speaker: SWAT MEMBER
utterance.content: State police! Go, go!

utterance.speaker: SWAT MEMBER
utterance.content: We’ve got two hostages!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s the Northcliffs.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What the hell is this?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad? Where are they?

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY NORTHCLIFF
utterance.content: There’s a building hidden in the trees at the bottom of the hill.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Who’s behind this? Who left you here?

utterance.speaker: SAMANTHA NORTHCLIFF
utterance.content: Our son, Brandon.

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: We’re out of time. You need to choose which ones of you are staying in here with me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll stay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fine. But I’m not letting you stay here alone. Patricia, you stay here with the others.

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: But the instructions say your better half. If you both stay that’s breaking the rules.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Screw the rules!

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: There could be consequences for all of us!

utterance.speaker: JUDAH
utterance.content: There were consequences when we followed the rules, too.

utterance.speaker: PATTY
utterance.content: Thank you. We’ll send help!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what now?

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: I’m sorry. I thought we could run out the door.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really? So it’s not because we broke your rules?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Though he did say that there would be consequences.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We know it’s you.

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: Damnit.

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: Don’t. What gave me away?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When you ran into this room, even though we all suspected it would be booby trapped.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And when you pulled that lever you didn’t even hesitate.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Same way you didn’t hesitate when Simon pulled the trigger. You weren’t afraid. And not because you’re a minister with faith, but because you were a mastermind with the knowledge that the gun was rigged to fire backwards.

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: Not like this one.

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: Let’s finish the experiment. One of you has to die. Those are the rules.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why are you doing this?

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: That’s the same question I asked my parents when they would rip me away from twin sister. Testing us, over and over, day after day.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look, no one should be treated the way you and your sister were.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let us help you.

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: Help me? You? Why? ‘cause you’re a cop? I talked to a cop once. When I was a kid. You know what happened? He sent over two officers from the Twelfth Precinct. Your precinct. They talked to my parents for five minutes, then walked away.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: Not as sorry as my sister was. My parents ordered more isolation. More tests.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you’re holding Beckett responsible? That – she was a child when that happened. Why are you punishing her?

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: This isn’t punishment. This is science.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Patricia is a psychiatrist on the Board of Education. Did someone there let you and your sister down?

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: Kate, everyone let us down.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So we’re all surrogates for people that weren’t able to protect you two.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But you were careful to choose people who love each other. Because you loved your sister. She was your soulmate.

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: Now one of you has to feel what I feel.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, why did you choose Emma?

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: She wanted to expose my parents. That’s not enough! Video tapes of some kids doing puzzles? That’s nothing. A blip in the news cycle. But one of you goes free and tells how I killed your one true love and myself. Only then will the world truly understand the monster my parents created. No more talking. Time to solve the final puzzle. Which one of you dies?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I won’t choose.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Neither will I.

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: Decide. Or I’ll start maiming you until someone does.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, okay. I’ll choose. I’ll – I’ll decide.

utterance.speaker: TODD
utterance.content: Good. Who dies, Rick?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No one dies.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t move.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You guys okay?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Thanks for rescuing us.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Yes, because clearly you were helpless without us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How did you guys even find us?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, we had our best person on it.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I can’t leave you alone for five minutes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Does this mean no hug?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Hey, I’m heading out for a bit of fun. Want to come with?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’ll pass. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: How’re you doing?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: You worry a lot about your father.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You would too, if Richard Castle was your dad. I mean, the guy’s abducted like, what, twice a year? I think that’s a tad above the national average.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Yet he always comes home. Do you know why that is?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah. He’s really lucky.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: No. He’s really good at what he does.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Is he as good as you?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Good heavens, no. Why would you ask such a thing? All right, we’re going to get you dolled up. We are going to go out to some clubs, we’re going to get into just a tiny little bit of trouble. Never hurt anyone. Come on.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. I was just thinking about those little kids. I mean, a lot of people let them down.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And although their parents are finally being exposed, it’s far too little too late.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmm. This is not the day I was expecting when I woke up this morning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tell me about it. But … at least it’s ending well.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.
